cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 195 miles ESE of the Mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: continuing west-northwest, slowing and then turning northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (southeast Louisiana–Mississippi coast) before moving inland and curving northeast across AL/TN later in the week
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeastern Louisiana or the Mississippi coast (near the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Ocean Springs, MS)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Storm-surge and tropical-storm watches from the Mississippi/Alabama border eastward to the Alabama/Florida border and Indian Pass to Ochlockonee River, FL (Gulf Coast only)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane and storm-surge warnings from Morgan City, LA to Ocean Springs, MS including Lake Pontchartrain/Maurepas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern and north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through the western Florida Panhandle; inland Mississippi, Alabama, Tennessee and neighboring states later in the week
weather_observation.wind: Breezy conditions possible late Thursday into Friday with peak sustained winds generally below tropical-storm force (less than 39 mph), based on 3 % probability of 34-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: No significant storm-surge threat indicated for the Georgia coast; surge focus remains along Gulf Coast west of Florida.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rain bands/remnant moisture could bring 1–3 in (locally up to 4 in) to coastal Georgia late week, potentially causing minor ponding and delays.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf and dangerous rip currents along the southeast Georgia beaches beginning mid-week; isolated brief tornado risk inland Friday as remnants pass north of the port.
